content: cobbles & vines book nook crochet pattern by @o_layarn the cobbles & vines book nook is a fun crochet pattern to create a cosy book nook the stitch used is custom easy and fully explained in the pattern and it requires only one colour change so no worries about having too many ends to weave in it uses little yarn and it s a quick crochet make so it s perfect for a last minute new decoration in your house or as a gift to a friend please feel free to contact me at any time if you need help with this pattern either on instagram at @o_layarn or emailing me at lolla olayarn@gmail com if you enjoy crocheting this book sleeve check out the other patterns that are in my shop and my blog © this pattern is for personal use only and cannot be redistributed in any of its parts you may sell physical products created with this pattern but in small quantities skill level adventurous beginner pattern content final sizing - yarn - materials/notions - hooks - construction page 1 stitches and abbreviations page 2 special techniques - gauge pages 2-3 pattern pages 4-5 borders & straps page 6 mount the dowel page 6 cord page 7 final page 7 tester gallery pages 8-9 final sizing the final piece is 23 cm in width x 28 cm in length - considering only the crochet fabric if you want to adjust it for your desired measurements consider the following each square is 2 cm in width and 2 5 cm in length the chain used to hang the nook is 20 cm as length in between the dowel and the hook yarn dk yarn i used prima 100% super soft dk acrylic yarn 100 g/280 m colour a blue in pics 40 g colour b sage green in pics 35 g 210 m in total materials/notions scissors measuring tape threading needle dowel the one in pics is 30 cm hooks note use hook sizes as below or sizes needed to meet gauge 4 5 mm crochet hook construction the cobbles & vines book nook is crocheted all in one piece then a 1 simple border is added in the end the book nook is mounted on a dowel and a chain to hang the nook is also added stitches and abbreviations used ● chain chain ● front post double_crochet fpdc find a quick video here full tutorial below ● right/wrong side rs/ws on the left the rs - where you see the squares on the right the ws - where you see the horizontal lines ● single_crochet* single_crochet ● slip_stitch slip_stitch ● stitch es st s ● turning chain tc - does not count as a stitch ● yarn over yo * tip for a sturdier make crochet the single_crochet with the yarn under instead of yarn over method so insert the hook yarn under pull up a loop pull through two loops this is how i crochet
